courseDetails.title: ESG 101: Basics for Beginners
courseDetails.shortDescription: A Short Introductive Course on ESG
courseDetails.longDescription:
• In the last few years, corporations' Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) performance has been a trendy topic.

  • While traditional financial analysis has always considered various financial indicators, like revenues, liabilities, cash, inventory, machinery, and competitors, ESG, however, refers to additional non-financial information about companies.


  • Following the emergence of ESG, a new type of investment called ESG investment was born.


  • ESG investment is an investment philosophy that pursues long-term value growth, and it is a comprehensive, concrete, and down-to-earth governance method.

  • In this course, we will discover ESG essentials for corporations and investors through the following plan:

01 Introduction & Context

02 What is ESG?

03 Why is ESG Important for Corporations & Investors?

04 How is ESG Evaluated?

05 What is ESG Investment?

06 What are ESG Investment Strategies?

07 What are ESG Investment Challenges?

08 Example of ESG Investment: Norwegian Pension Fund

09 Conclusion & References

Welcome to program: Professional Certificate in Operations Management

MTF is the global educational and research institute with HQ at Lisbon, Portugal, focused on business & professional hybrid (on-campus and online) education at areas: Business & Administration, Science & Technology, Banking & Finance.

MTF is present in 208 countries and has been chosen by more than 520 000 students.


Course Author:

Dr. Joao Martins is seasoned manager and entrepreneur, with over 30 years’ experience in top management positions in the telecommunications and IT sectors. Starting in an academic environment, where he obtained his PhD in Engineering and an MBA at Universidade Nova de Lisboa, quickly evolved to C-suite positions in the corporate environment, both in large corporations and in start-ups.

He is currently a director and start-up shareholder in an IT integrator in Lisbon, focused on cybersecurity. With a passion for education, he also an invited Professor at Nova Information Management School, teaching Knowledge Management and Financial Analysis to graduate and undergraduate students.


Operations management (OM) is the administration of business practices to create the highest level of efficiency possible within an organization. It is concerned with converting materials and labor into goods and services as efficiently as possible to maximize the profit of an organization. OM covers all aspects of a business, from the design and management of products, services, and processes, to the management of supply chains and logistics.


Importance of Operations Management Skills for Career and Business:

Developing skills in operations management can significantly benefit your career and entrepreneurial endeavors in the following ways:

Career:

  • Enhanced Employability: Operations management skills are highly sought after in various industries, including manufacturing, healthcare, technology, retail, and service sectors. Expertise in OM can open up a wide range of career opportunities, such as operations manager, supply chain analyst, production planner, quality manager, project manager, and more.

  • Increased Earning Potential: Professionals with strong operations management skills often command higher salaries due to their ability to optimize processes, reduce costs, improve efficiency, and drive overall business success.

  • Problem-Solving and Decision-Making Abilities: Operations management equips you with the skills to analyze complex problems, identify bottlenecks, and make data-driven decisions that lead to improved operational performance. These skills are valuable assets for any career path.


Building Your Own Business:

  • Efficient Resource Utilization: Understanding operations management helps entrepreneurs optimize the use of resources like labor, materials, and capital, leading to cost savings and increased profitability.

  • Streamlined Processes: Effective OM ensures smooth workflow, reduced waste, and timely delivery of products or services, which are crucial for customer satisfaction and business growth.

  • Quality Improvement: By implementing quality control measures and continuous improvement initiatives, OM helps businesses deliver high-quality products or services that meet or exceed customer expectations.

  • Supply Chain Optimization: Managing the flow of goods and services from suppliers to customers is essential for a successful business. Operations management skills enable entrepreneurs to build and maintain efficient supply chains, reducing lead times and ensuring timely deliveries.

  • Competitive Advantage: A well-managed operation can be a significant competitive advantage for a business. It allows companies to offer better products or services at lower prices, leading to increased market share and profitability.


Overall, building skills in operations management provides a solid foundation for a successful career in various industries and equips entrepreneurs with the tools they need to run efficient, profitable, and competitive businesses. Whether you aspire to climb the corporate ladder or launch your own venture, investing in operations management skills is a wise decision.
targetAudiences: No special requirements. Course for any who want to build a career at business or improve their knowledge.

courseDetails.title: The Complete Microsoft Excel Data Analysis Bootcamp
courseDetails.shortDescription: Excel Data Analysis Bootcamp: Learn How to Clean, Analyze & Present Data Professionally with Comprehensive Excel Skills
courseDetails.longDescription:
Unlock the full potential of Microsoft Excel with "The Complete Microsoft Excel Data Analysis Bootcamp." This comprehensive course is designed to take you from a beginner to an advanced user, equipping you with the skills to perform powerful data analysis and make data-driven decisions confidently.


Whether you’re a professional looking to enhance your data analysis skills, a student eager to learn one of the most valuable tools in the job market, or a business owner wanting to make more informed decisions, this bootcamp covers everything you need. You’ll learn to use Excel's robust features for data cleaning, analysis, visualization, and automation, mastering tools such as PivotTables, VLOOKUP, Power Query, and advanced charting techniques.


Through step-by-step tutorials, real-world examples, and hands-on exercises, you’ll gain the knowledge to analyze large datasets, create insightful reports, and automate repetitive tasks, saving you time and effort. By the end of this course, you’ll be proficient in using Excel for data analysis, making you an invaluable asset in any data-driven role.


What You'll Learn:

  • Excel Fundamentals: Understand the basics of Excel, including navigation, functions, and formulas.

  • Data Cleaning and Preparation: Learn techniques to clean and prepare datasets for analysis, ensuring accuracy and reliability.

  • Advanced Formulas and Functions: Master complex functions like VLOOKUP, INDEX-MATCH, and array formulas to manipulate data efficiently.

  • PivotTables and PivotCharts: Use PivotTables and PivotCharts to summarize, analyze, and visualize large datasets with ease.

  • Data Visualization: Create dynamic and interactive charts and dashboards to present data insights clearly and effectively.

  • Power Query and Power Pivot: Explore Excel’s powerful data modeling and analysis tools to handle large datasets and complex calculations.

  • Automation with Macros and VBA: Learn to automate repetitive tasks using Excel’s macro recorder and Visual Basic for Applications (VBA).

  • Real-World Projects: Apply your skills to real-world scenarios with hands-on projects that simulate actual business data challenges.


Includes This Course:


Module 1: Excel Basics

  • Navigating the Excel Interface

  • Basic Excel Functions and Formulas

  • Entering and Editing Data

  • Sorting and Filtering Data

  • Data Validation

Module 2: Data Cleaning and Preparation

Module 3: Data Analysis Techniques

  • Mean, Median, Mode

  • Standard Deviation and Variance

  • Data Visualization with Charts

  • Creating Pivot Tables

  • Analyzing Data with Pivot Tables

  • Using Pivot Charts for Visualization

Module 4: Advanced Excel Functions

  • IF, AND, OR Functions

  • Conditional Formatting

  • VLOOKUP, HLOOKUP, INDEX, MATCH

  • Using Dynamic Ranges

  • Install Data Analysis Toolpak

  • Using Analysis Tools (e.g., regression, correlation)

Module 5: Data Visualization

  • Types of Charts and their Uses

  • Customizing Chart Elements

  • Using Sparklines

  • Creating Interactive Dashboards

Module 6: Case Studies and Real-World Applications

  • Analyzing Sales Data

  • Data Analysis For Decision Making

  • Monthly Budget Analysis

  • Sales Projection and Forecast Calculation


Who This Course is For:

  • Professionals looking to enhance their Excel skills for data analysis.

  • Students and graduates seeking to gain a competitive edge in the job market.

Enrolling in this course will transform you into an Excel power user, capable of analyzing data, creating insightful reports, and automating workflows with confidence. With practical, hands-on experience and expert instruction, you'll be ready to tackle any data challenge and drive impactful decisions in your organization. Start your journey to Excel mastery today!

Course provided by MTF Institute of Management, Technology and Finance

MTF is the global educational and research institute with HQ at Lisbon, Portugal, focused on business & professional hybrid (on-campus and online) education at areas: Business & Administration, Science & Technology, Banking & Finance.

MTF R&D center focused on research activities at areas: Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, Data Science, Big Data, WEB3, Blockchain, Cryptocurrency & Digital Assets, Metaverses, Digital Transformation, Fintech, Electronic Commerce, Internet of Things.

Course Author:

Dr. Pedro Nunes has built a multifaceted career combining academia and practical business expertise. His educational journey culminated with a Doctorate in Economic Analysis and Business Strategy with a cum laude mention from the University of Santiago de Compostela. Professionally, he has navigated through various sectors, including technology, international commerce, and consultancy, with roles ranging from business analyst to director. Currently, Pedro serves as a Professor in several DBA programs, applying his extensive industry experience and academic insights to educate the next generation of professionals.


Course Description:

Are you ready to transition from a data technician who runs reports to a trusted strategic advisor who drives decisions?

In a world overflowing with data, the most valuable professionals are not those who can simply operate software, but those who can think critically, ask the right questions, and connect data to high-level business strategy. This is the course designed to teach you that exact skill.

This is not another software tutorial. This is a masterclass in analytical thinking, designed by the MTF Institute and led by Dr. Pedro Nunes, that will fundamentally change the way you see the relationship between data and business success.


In This Course, You Will Go Beyond the Dashboard to Master:

  • The Strategic Mindset: Learn to frame business problems correctly before you even look at the data, ensuring your analysis is always relevant and impactful.

  • The Logic of Data: Grasp the core principles of how data is structured and extracted using SQL, allowing you to intelligently query and understand complex datasets.

  • The Art of Discovery: Master Exploratory Data Analysis (EDA) to find the hidden patterns, anomalies, and initial insights that form the basis of every great analysis.

  • Persuasive Data Storytelling: Learn to translate complex findings into clear, compelling narratives and visualizations that convince stakeholders and drive action.

  • The Future of Analytics: Demystify Machine Learning and AI, understanding the core concepts of predictive analytics so you can identify opportunities for innovation.

  • High-Level Corporate Strategy: Apply your data skills to powerful strategic frameworks like SWOT and Porter's Five Forces to influence major company decisions.

  • Process Mining: Uncover how your business actually works by analyzing the digital footprints in your data to find and eliminate hidden bottlenecks.

  • Ethical and Responsible Analysis: Navigate the critical complexities of data bias, privacy, and governance to become a trusted, ethical professional.


A Journey from Foundations to Boardroom-Level Strategy

This course takes you on a logical journey through the mind of a world-class analyst. We begin by laying the Strategic Foundation, teaching you how to think before you analyze. You'll then learn the essential logic of SQL and the critical, real-world skill of Data Wrangling and Preparation.

From there, we dive into the heart of analysis with Exploratory Data Analysis (EDA) and learn how to communicate your findings through the Art of Data Storytelling.

But we don't stop there. We elevate your skills by introducing you to the concepts of Predictive Analytics and Machine Learning, showing you how to look into the future. You will learn to apply all these skills in Domain-Specific Case Studies covering marketing, finance, and operations.

Finally, we take you to the highest level of strategic thinking. You'll learn to power classic Strategy Frameworks with data, understand the crucial role of Data Ethics and Governance, and discover the hidden world of process inefficiencies with Process Mining.


A Focus on Principles, Not Tools

This course is intentionally different. We believe that tools and software change, but the principles of critical thinking, strategic analysis, and effective communication are timeless. While we will cover the concepts behind technologies like SQL and BI platforms, our primary focus is on the frameworks and mental models that will empower you throughout your entire career. This course teaches you how to think, a skill that transcends any single piece of software.


Who Is This Course For?

  • Aspiring analysts who want to build a strong, foundational understanding of the purpose of analysis.

  • Current Business or Data Analysts who want to move beyond technical tasks and become more strategic advisors.

  • Business Managers and Consultants who need to understand how to leverage data for better decision-making.

  • MBA students and other business professionals who want to develop a data-driven mindset.

  • Anyone who wants to understand how data truly drives modern business, far beyond the buzzwords and dashboards.


Unlock Your Strategic Potential

If you are ready to become an indispensable analytical thinker who can confidently bridge the gap between raw data and real-world value, this is the course for you.

Enroll today and start your journey to mastering the strategy of business and data analysis!

  • Comprender el manejo de eventos en React, crear un botón tipo switch. manejará los métodos setState() y prevState(), el manejo del estado previo con prevState(), ejemplo del manejo de eventos, crear un botón submit, validar los datos del formulario,manejar y desplegar los errores del formulario, creará un sencillo blog, creará los eventos para contar los caracteres del blog.

  • Manejar el renderizado condicional, el renderizado embebido, desplegar las preguntas, manejo de los eventos en los botones del quiz, evaluar la respuesta del usuario, desplegará el resultado de la selección del usuario, creará los elementos en variables y el manejo render null.

  • Comprender las listas y "keys", simplificar el código con listas y keys y desarrollar un sencillo juego de memoria.

  • Crear un sencillo sistema de mensajería en React y un Tablero de comentarios.

Este curso está dirigido a desarrolladores web y frontend. Para aprovechar este curso deberás tener conocimientos generales de JavaScript y de desarrollo web. En todo momento contarás con los archivos del curso.

courseDetails.title: Sustainable Manufacturing: Review & Emerging Advances
courseDetails.shortDescription: A short course on what you need to know about Sustainable Manufacturing
courseDetails.longDescription:
Being responsible for over 20% of accumulated greenhouse gas emissions, the manufacturing sector has been the third major contributor to the overall global environmental pollution. Given the high awareness of the need for a better quality of life, the socio-economic impacts of manufacturing activities are also globally recognized.


According to the UN Environment Programme report, both the production and the consumption sides of the industrial cycle carry significant harmful impacts on the environment in the form of toxic gases and acidic substances released, as well as the immense drainage of non-renewable resources.


Hence, manufacturing processes and the industrial supply chain are among the most damaging factors, where timely industrial action and policy intervention are crucial. Sustainable manufacturing has made big strides in recent years and has changed the industry considerably.


This course introduces the subject of Sustainable manufacturing at the beginning and follows with a brief reminder on sustainability, and then dives into the concept of sustainable manufacturing. The course explains afterwards the pillars of sustainable manufacturing, which include Supply chain, Materials, Design and production, and management and policy-making. This course also takes an interest in emerging advances in Sustainable Manufacturing, such as Industry 4.0, Circular economy, Additive manufacturing, and the use of Sustainable materials.


The topic of Sustainable manufacturing is covered from many angles through the following plan:


  1. Introduction

  2. Brief Reminder on Sustainability

  3. Understanding the Concept of Sustainable Manufacturing

  4. Key Areas of Sustainable Manufacturing

  5. Emerging Advances in Sustainable Manufacturing

  6. Take-home Lessons & Recommendations


I hope you enroll in the course to learn interesting knowledge about the trendy topic of Sustainable Manufacturing!

Regards!!

Green Courses
targetAudiences: ESG Professionals, Supply Chain Professionals, Curious Learners.

courseDetails.title: Pivot Tables - Microsoft Excel Pivot Table and Data Analysis

Course Author:

Dr. Pedro Nunes has built a multifaceted career combining academia and practical business expertise. His educational journey culminated with a Doctorate in Economic Analysis and Business Strategy with a cum laude mention from the University of Santiago de Compostela. Professionally, he has navigated through various sectors, including technology, international commerce, and consultancy, with roles ranging from business analyst to director. Currently, Pedro serves as a Professor in several DBA programs, applying his extensive industry experience and academic insights to educate the next generation of professionals.


The Decision-Making Process is a systematic approach to identifying and evaluating options, leading to informed choices. It's a structured framework that helps individuals and organizations tackle complex problems and make decisions that align with their goals and values.


Why is the Decision-Making Process Important for Business?

  • Informed Choices: It reduces the risk of making impulsive or uninformed decisions, leading to better outcomes.

  • Resource Optimization: By carefully considering alternatives, businesses can allocate resources more effectively.

  • Risk Management: It enables the identification and mitigation of potential risks associated with each option.

  • Efficiency: A streamlined process saves time and ensures that decisions are made promptly.

  • Accountability: It provides a clear rationale for decisions, making it easier to justify them and learn from mistakes.

  • Adaptability: Businesses can respond to changing circumstances more effectively when they have a structured process in place.


Importance for Leaders and Managers

  • Strategic Direction: Leaders can use the process to shape the overall direction of the organization.

  • Problem-Solving: Managers can address operational issues and challenges systematically.

  • Team Engagement: Involving team members in the process fosters collaboration and buy-in.

  • Leadership Development: Making sound decisions builds credibility and confidence in leaders.

  • Conflict Resolution: The process can help resolve disagreements by providing a neutral framework.


How Decision-Making Skills Support Career Building

  • Employability: Decision-making skills are highly valued by employers across various industries.

  • Advancement: Individuals who demonstrate strong decision-making abilities are often promoted to leadership roles.

  • Problem-Solver Reputation: People known for making good decisions become go-to resources for their teams.

  • Adaptability: Those with honed decision-making skills can navigate changing job markets and career paths.

  • Confidence: Making sound decisions consistently builds self-assurance and resilience.


Steps in the Decision-Making Process:

  1. Identify the Problem: Clearly define the issue or decision that needs to be addressed.

  2. Gather Information: Collect relevant data and facts related to the problem.

  3. Identify Alternatives: Generate a list of possible solutions or courses of action.

  4. Evaluate Alternatives: Assess the pros and cons of each option, considering their potential impact.

  5. Choose the Best Alternative: Select the option that best aligns with your goals and values.

  6. Implement the Decision: Put the chosen solution into action.

  7. Review and Evaluate: Monitor the results of your decision and make adjustments as needed.


By mastering the decision-making process, individuals and businesses can make more confident, informed choices that lead to success and growth.
targetAudiences: No special requirements. A course for anyone who wants to build career in management and business

courseDetails.longDescription:
Artificial Intelligence is transforming the way we learn, work, and create — and mastering it has never been more important. AI for Beginners: Learn ChatGPT, Gemini, Perplexity and Grok is your all-in-one roadmap to understanding and using the world’s most powerful AI tools effectively. Whether you’re a student, entrepreneur, content creator, or professional, this course will equip you with the skills to harness AI for productivity, creativity, and growth.


In this comprehensive guide, you’ll explore four leading AI platforms that are shaping the digital landscape: ChatGPT by OpenAI, Gemini by Google, Perplexity AI, and Grok by xAI. Each of these tools offers unique strengths — and by mastering them, you’ll gain the confidence to choose the right one for every situation. You’ll learn how to use these AIs to write, research, generate ideas, automate workflows, and make smarter decisions in less time.


I’ll begin with ChatGPT, the conversational AI that started a global revolution. You’ll learn how to craft effective prompts, use advanced techniques for writing and brainstorming, and integrate ChatGPT into daily tasks. Then I’ll explore Gemini, Google’s AI assistant that combines powerful search capabilities with seamless integration across Gmail, Docs, and Sheets — helping you research, summarize, and analyze like a pro.


Next, I’ll dive into Perplexity AI, one of the most trusted AI research tools. You’ll discover how it provides accurate, cited answers and how you can use it to validate sources, summarize complex topics, and generate data-driven insights. Then, I’ll explore Grok, the AI developed by Elon Musk’s xAI, known for its humor, personality, and ability to pull live data from X (formerly Twitter). You’ll see how Grok’s conversational style can make learning, communication, and exploration more dynamic.


Throughout this course, I’ll focus on real-world, hands-on learning. You’ll work through guided exercises, explore prompt templates, and complete projects that mirror real-life applications — from writing blog posts and automating emails to conducting AI-driven market research. courseDetails.title: Excel Data Mastery: Formulas, Functions, Charts, and Graphs
courseDetails.shortDescription: Master Excel's data analysis and visualization tools: formulas, functions, charts, and graphs.
courseDetails.longDescription:
Master Excel from the Ground Up – Formulas, Functions, Visualizations & More!


This course is designed for anyone who wants to go beyond basic spreadsheet operations and truly harness Excel's capabilities. Whether you're a beginner looking for a solid foundation, an intermediate user aiming to level up your skills, or a professional seeking to enhance your data driven decision-making, you'll find immense value in our practical, hands-on approach.


We'll start with the fundamentals of powerful formulas and functions, moving into advanced data manipulation techniques, and culminating in the creation of impactful charts and graphs that tell compelling stories with your data. Through clear explanations, real world examples, and guided exercises, you'll build the confidence to tackle any data challenge.


What you'll learn:


  • Excel Formula Fundamentals & Best Practices: Master the basics of constructing effective formulas, understanding cell references (relative, absolute, mixed), and writing efficient calculations.

  • Essential Excel Functions for Data Manipulation: Dive deep into powerful functions like SUM, AVERAGE, COUNT, MAX, MIN, and advanced logical functions such as IF, AND, OR, NOT.

  • Lookup and Reference Mastery: Conquer data retrieval with VLOOKUP, HLOOKUP, INDEX, MATCH, and the highly sought-after XLOOKUP (for newer Excel versions) to efficiently combine and extract data.

  • Text and Date Functions for Data Cleaning: Learn to clean and transform data using functions like LEFT, RIGHT, MID, LEN, FIND, SEARCH, CONCATENATE (CONCAT), TEXTJOIN, TRIM, CLEAN, DATE, YEAR, MONTH, DAY, TODAY, NOW, and DATEDIF.

  • Conditional Aggregation with SUMIFS, COUNTIFS, AVERAGEIFS: Perform sophisticated data summaries based on multiple criteria, allowing for dynamic reporting and analysis.

  • Introduction to Dynamic Array Functions (for Excel 365/2021 users): Get a head start with modern functions like SORT, SORTBY, UNIQUE, FILTER, SEQUENCE, and RANDARRAY to streamline complex tasks.

  • Crafting Professional Charts & Graphs: Understand the principles of effective data visualization and learn to create a wide array of charts including Column, Bar, Line, Pie, Scatter, Area, and Combination Charts.

  • Advanced Chart Customization and Formatting: Discover how to tailor your charts with titles, labels, legends, axes formatting, data series customization, trendlines, and more to enhance clarity and impact.

  • Using Sparklines and Conditional Formatting: Add mini-charts directly in cells and apply rules to highlight data trends and anomalies visually.

  • Organizing and Summarizing Data with Tables & PivotTables (Introduction): Get an overview of how Excel Tables enhance data management and a sneak peek into the power of PivotTables for advanced summarization.

  • Tips and Tricks for Efficiency: Boost your productivity with keyboard shortcuts, data validation, and other time-saving techniques.


By the end of this course, you will be able to:


  • Write complex and efficient Excel formulas and functions with confidence.

  • Clean, prepare, and manipulate raw data for analysis.

  • Generate meaningful insights from large datasets.

  • Create a wide variety of professional and impactful charts and graphs.

  • Communicate your data stories effectively through stunning visualizations.

  • Work more efficiently and confidently with Excel, saving time and increasing accuracy.


Enroll now and become an Excel Data Master – turning numbers into narratives and insights into action!
targetAudiences: Anyone looking to transform raw data into actionable insights and compelling visuals.
Individuals preparing for roles that require strong Excel proficiency in data analysis and reporting.
Students, professionals, and anyone who needs to analyze data and present findings clearly.
Who want to learn Excel from the ground up, focusing on practical data skills.

courseDetails.title: Aprende JavaScript sin dolor
courseDetails.shortDescription: Aprende el lenguaje que dominan internet: JavaScript
courseDetails.longDescription:
Este curso tiene como objetivo que usted aprenda JavaScript sin que sea programador. Revisaremos desde sus inicios la sintaxis del lenguaje, el manejo de sus variables, lo que es una sentencia condicional, los ciclos, las funciones, los arreglos y otros objetos, asi como la estructura DOM, que es fundamental para el manejo avanzado de las páginas, como es HTML5 y jQuerys. También revisaremos el manejo de los eventos con este potente lenguaje. También graficaremos con la poderosa librería ChartJS:

Javascript es la tercera capa del pastes, donde la MDN nos indica:

  • HTML es el lenguaje de marcado que usamos para estructurar y dar significado a nuestro contenido web, por ejemplo, definiendo párrafos, encabezados y tablas de datos, o insertando imágenes y videos en la página.

  • CSS es un lenguaje de reglas de estilo que usamos para aplicar estilo a nuestro contenido HTML, por ejemplo, establecer colores de fondo y tipos de letra, y distribuir nuestro contenido en múltiples columnas.

  • JavaScript es un lenguaje de secuencias de comandos que te permite crear contenido de actualización dinámica, controlar multimedia, animar imágenes y prácticamente todo lo demás. (Está bien, no todo, pero es sorprendente lo que puedes lograr con unas pocas líneas de código JavaScript).

Los objetivos del presente curso son:

  • Crear variables de tipo cadena, numérico y booleanos.

  • Crear estructuras condicionales y ciclos como for, while o do... while

  • Modificar las cadenas y subcadenas, así como leerá los caracteres de una subcadena, así como crear funciones propias.

  • Crear, poblar y recorrer objetos y arreglos, así como el manejo de fechas.

  • Comprender el modelo orientado de un documento (DOM) en HTML y su manipulación con JavaScript.

  • Utilizar lo aprendido hasta el momento para desarrollar una galería de imágenes con JavaScript.

  • Manejar los objetos propios del navegador con JavaScript.

  • Aprender a detectar los eventos de los diferentes medios como el ratón, el teclado, los elementos de un formulario, el scroll de la ventana del navegador.

  • Aplicar sus conocimientos en el desarrollo de pequeñas aplicaciones con JavaScript

  • Revisar los métodos utilizados en JavaScript.

  • Conectar algoritmos de JavaScript, AJAX, PHP, MySQL y XML.

  • Aprender la sintaxis de JSON, sucreación, su lectura por AJAX, su creación con PHP desde una base de datos.

  • Aprender las funciones de callback, expresiones en funciones, el ciclo forEach(), las funciones anónimas, el "infierno" de los callbacks, contexto léxico.

  • Aprender el manejo de símbolos,  incluir variables y valores en las cadenas con Template Strings, definir variables y constantes, literales octales.

  • Unir lo aprendido en las secciones anteriores para realizar ejemplo con JavaScript, Ajax, PHP y MySQL.

  • Graficaremos con la librería ChartJS.

Este curso está orientado a desarrolladores web, de parte del Front-End.
targetAudiences: Diseñadores y desarrolladores web

With a passion for interdisciplinary collaboration and a commitment to driving positive change, Alex Amoroso is dedicated to empowering learners and professionals for usage of cutting edge methodologies for achieving of excellence in global business world.


Business management is the process of planning, organizing, directing, and controlling the resources (financial, human, and material) within an organization to achieve its goals and objectives effectively and efficiently. It encompasses a wide range of activities, from setting strategic direction and making operational decisions to managing resources and leading people.


Why Learning and Developing Skills in Business Management are Important for Building a Career:

  1. Versatility: Business management skills are applicable across industries and sectors. Whether you aspire to work in healthcare, technology, finance, or any other field, understanding business fundamentals will give you a strong foundation for success.

  2. Career Advancement: Professionals with strong business management skills are highly sought after for leadership and management positions. Developing these skills can open doors to career advancement opportunities and increased earning potential.

  3. Problem-Solving: Business management teaches critical thinking and problem-solving skills. You'll learn to identify challenges, analyze situations, and develop effective solutions.

  4. Communication and Collaboration: Effective communication and collaboration are essential in any business environment. Strong business managers are able to build relationships, motivate teams, and negotiate successfully.

  5. Adaptability: The business landscape is constantly evolving. Business management skills equip you to adapt to change, embrace new technologies, and navigate uncertainty.


Importance of Learning Linked Topics:

  • Business Models and Value Propositions: Understanding how businesses create, deliver, and capture value is crucial for identifying opportunities, developing new products or services, and ensuring long-term sustainability.

  • Strategic Management and Planning: This involves setting long-term goals, analyzing the competitive environment, and developing strategies to achieve success. Strong strategic thinking is essential for making informed decisions and guiding the organization towards its vision.

  • Organizational Behavior and Leadership: Effective leaders understand how to motivate and inspire teams, manage conflict, and create a positive work environment. Knowledge of organizational behavior is key to building high-performing teams and fostering a culture of innovation.

  • Risk Management and Business Continuity Planning: Businesses face a variety of risks, from financial and operational disruptions to natural disasters. Risk management involves identifying potential threats, assessing their impact, and implementing strategies to mitigate or avoid them. Business continuity planning ensures that critical operations can continue in the event of a disruption.

  • Change Management and Organizational Development: Organizations must continuously adapt to remain competitive. Change management skills are essential for leading and managing change initiatives effectively, while organizational development focuses on improving the overall performance and effectiveness of the organization.

  • Corporate Governance and Compliance: This involves ensuring that the organization operates ethically, transparently, and in accordance with relevant laws and regulations. Strong corporate governance practices build trust with stakeholders and protect the organization's reputation.

By developing a comprehensive understanding of business management and related topics, you'll gain the knowledge and skills necessary to build a successful career, make a positive impact, and contribute to the growth and development of your organization.
targetAudiences: No special requirements. Course for any who want to build a career at business or improve their knowledge.

courseDetails.title: The Complete SQL Course: From Zero to Data Analyst
courseDetails.shortDescription: Master Foundational to Advanced SQL Concepts, including Joins, Subqueries, and Window Functions
courseDetails.longDescription:
Are you ready to unlock the power of data? This comprehensive course is your all-in-one guide to mastering SQL and launching your career as a Data Analyst. Whether you're a complete beginner or a professional looking to add a crucial skill to your toolkit, this course will take you from zero to hero.


SQL (Structured Query Language) is the universal language of data. It is the most in-demand skill for data related jobs, including Data Analyst, Business Intelligence Analyst, Data Scientist, and Database Administrator. This course is designed to provide you with a solid foundation and advanced practical skills to confidently tackle real world data challenges.


What You’ll Learn:

  • What SQL is and how it works in real world databases

  • How to write SQL queries from scratch using MySQL and PostgreSQL

  • How to filter, sort, and transform data using SELECT, WHERE, GROUP BY, HAVING, and more

  • How to join multiple tables and work with relational databases

  • How to use aggregate functions, subqueries, and window functions

  • How to analyze data and answer real business questions

  • How to design reports and prepare data for visualization tools


This Course Include

Module 1: Introduction to SQL and Databases   

  • What is SQL and Why is it Important?

  • Relational Database Management Systems (RDBMS).

  • Overview of Popular RDBMS: MySQL, PostgreSQL, SQL Server, and SQLite.

  • Installing and Setting up SQL Tools and Environment.


Module 2: SQL Basics   

  • Understanding Database Structure: Tables, Rows, and Columns.

  • Writing Your First SQL Query.

  • Basic SQL Commands: SELECT, INSERT, UPDATE, DELETE.

  • Data Types in SQL.


Module 3: Querying Data 

  • Sorting Data with ORDER BY.

  • Limiting Results with LIMIT (MySQL) and FETCH FIRST (PostgreSQL).

  • Pattern Matching with LIKE and Wildcards.


Module 4: Advanced Query Techniques   

  • Aggregate Functions: COUNT, SUM, AVG, MIN, MAX.

  • Grouping Data with GROUP BY and HAVING.

  • Joining Tables: INNER JOIN, LEFT JOIN, RIGHT JOIN, FULL OUTER JOIN.


Module 5: Database Design and Normalization    

  • Designing a Relational Database Schema.

  • Primary Keys, Foreign Keys, and Relationships.

  • Normalization and its Forms: 1NF, 2NF, 3NF.


Module 6: Managing Databases and Tables   

  • Creating, Modifying, and Deleting Databases and Tables.

  • Adding Constraints: NOT NULL, UNIQUE, CHECK.

  • Indexing for Performance Improvement.


Module 7: Advanced SQL Concepts   

  • Views: Creating and Managing Virtual Tables.

  • Stored Procedures and Functions.

  • Triggers and Events in SQL.


Module 8: Working with Multiple RDBMS   

  • Differences Between MySQL, PostgreSQL, SQL Server, and SQLite.

  • Connecting SQL with Python for Automation.

  • Using SQL with Data Visualization Tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI).


By the end of this course, you will not only be proficient in SQL but also understand the mindset of a data analyst. You will have the skills, knowledge, and confidence to land a job or start a career working with data.


Start learning SQL today—and take your first step toward becoming a Data Analyst.

This knowledge will empower you to navigate the complexities of regulatory compliance confidently and effectively.

In addition to these theoretical insights, you will gain practical knowledge crucial for a career in compliance area. You will be able to identify red flags as a real compliance officer, with the skills needed to detect and address potential compliance issues proactively.


Do you want to build a global career at the Wealth Management, Private Banking and Compliance?

Join our new course from globally recognized experts: Barbara Gutsch (15+ years of international experience in banking and finance, incl. 7+ years in Swiss private banking as risk and compliance manager) and Olga Margolin (17+ years in Swiss private banking industry, as top executive and business owner, managing international client relationships).


Agenda

  • Regulatory Frameworks and Compliance Standards in a Nutshell

  • Key Requirements faced by Banking Institutions

  • Why Compliance Matters? Consequences of Non-Compliance

  • Methods of Risk Mitigation and Prevention of Compliance Violations

  • Emerging Trends and Future Outlook in Regulatory Compliance


Regulatory Compliance refers to an organization's adherence to laws, regulations, guidelines, and specifications relevant to its business processes. These rules can be external (governmental, industry-specific) or internal (company policies).


Importance of Developing Regulatory Compliance Skills for Managers and Companies:

1. Risk Mitigation:

  • Legal and Financial Penalties: Non-compliance can lead to hefty fines, lawsuits, and even criminal charges for managers. By understanding regulations, managers can proactively identify potential risks and ensure compliance, thus safeguarding their companies' financial health.

  • Reputational Damage: Regulatory violations can tarnish a company's reputation, leading to loss of customer trust, decreased sales, and difficulty attracting investors. A manager skilled in compliance can prevent such scenarios.

  • Operational Disruptions: Non-compliance can lead to business interruptions or shutdowns. Managers with a strong compliance background can ensure smooth operations by implementing effective controls and procedures.


2. Strategic Advantage:

  • Competitive Edge: Companies with robust compliance programs are often viewed as more reliable and trustworthy by customers and partners. This can translate to increased business opportunities and market share.

  • Innovation: A deep understanding of regulatory landscapes can help managers identify opportunities for innovative products or services that meet emerging compliance requirements.

  • Investor Confidence: Investors are more likely to invest in companies with strong compliance records, as it demonstrates responsible management and reduces investment risk.


3. Career Advancement for Managers:

  • Increased Employability: Regulatory compliance is a sought-after skill set across industries. Managers who possess this expertise are highly valued and have a broader range of career opportunities.

  • Leadership Roles: Compliance often involves cross-functional collaboration and strategic decision-making, making it an excellent stepping stone to senior management positions.

  • Personal Growth: Staying updated on complex regulations requires continuous learning, which contributes to professional development and enhances a manager's overall skillset.


4. Ethical and Social Responsibility:

  • Protecting Consumers and Employees: Compliance with regulations ensures that products, services, and workplaces are safe for consumers and employees.

  • Sustainability: Many regulations address environmental concerns. Complying with these rules demonstrates a commitment to sustainability and corporate social responsibility.


Developing skills in regulatory compliance is not just a matter of following rules. It's about understanding the broader impact of regulations on businesses and society. By mastering this field, managers can protect their companies, advance their careers, and contribute to a safer and more sustainable business environment.

The Complete B2B Sales Course: Lead Generation to Closing
Master the art of B2B sales to include prospecting, lead generation, scripting, and closing from a Master Sales Trainer

Let’s face it. Sales is full of ups and downs, highs and lows, and tons of rejection. But it’s something about that one sale you do get that makes it all worth it.

So, how do you get more B2B sales? This is a leading question beginning sales professionals always ask. A better question is, what are the top sales professionals doing that I’m not to get unlimited leads and constant referrals?

In this course, we let the cat out of that bag. No longer are the sales tactics used by leading professionals a secret. This course will teach you how to master prospecting, lead generation, scripting, and handling objection. And this isn’t even half of it. You’ll also learn how to build trust quickly, and develop a mental framework that instills confidence when selling.

Here are the 10 B2B Sales modules this course will cover:

Prospecting:

Most salespeople agree they should be doing more prospecting.  They also agree that if they prospected more their sales would go up.  In this module, Eric will share with you proven techniques on how to prospect.  I will also share how to shift your mindset do you can boldly, fearlessly prospect anyone. 

Many of the techniques I cover you will be able to immediately use to prospect for more business.  If you know that you would make more sales by increasing your prospecting, then this is a must listen to the course.  Each idea you learn you will have for the rest of your life!  

Lead Generation:

Generating new leads is the lifeblood of any business.  In this module, Eric Lofholm will share his best lead generation ideas that helped him build his database from zero leads to over 50,000!  First Eric will cover lead generation best practices to generate hundreds or even thousands of additional leads. 

Next, you will learn the mindset of a superstar lead generator.  Then Eric will share his #1 lead generation strategy that has generated more than 1,000 leads for him.  Eric also talks about the importance of keeping your leads organized. 

In total, you will learn numerous tried and true lead generation ideas.  Once you have completed this course you will be able to immediately implement the ideas to start generating more leads!

Appointment Setting:

An appointment setting is one of the most important skill sets for a salesperson to learn and ultimately master. Eric Lofholm has been setting appointments since 1996. Eric began as an appointment setter for motivational superstar Tony Robbins.

He was then promoted to manage the appointment setting department. In 1999 Eric started his own sales training company and was responsible for booking all his appointments. In this course, Eric shares the best practices he has used to keep his calendar filled with appointments for over 20 years.

He will reveal his mindset as well as his best ideas about appointment setting. After completing this course, you will have ideas you can immediately use to book more appointments. You will have these skills for life.

Getting Referrals:

The purpose of this module is to teach how to get an extra hundred to a thousand referrals. With those extra referrals, I want you to generate extra additional income from the ideas of this program!

There are 3 ways to elevate your results with referrals – Inner Game, Outer Game and Action. The inner game is your mindset. The outer game is the how-to. Action is what you do.

My all-time number one idea is Continuous Sales Improvement (CSI), and you want to apply it to referrals. CSI is a lifelong commitment to working on your sales skills for 15 minutes to an hour a week and today we are working on referrals. You can look for referral techniques on YouTube, podcasts, books, and from other experts in your industries. Model other techniques to elevate your results.

Sales Scripting:

In this module, you will learn how to predictably increase your results with sales scripting.   

Preparation for a sales presentation is essential to repeatably achieve your desired outcomes. You may wonder why you would ever want to create a script. A script is simply a coherent string of words that make logical sense. We use scripts every day.

Here, Eric teaches you the why and how about carefully crafting and practicing your sales scripts. It is a learned skill and will help you achieve greater close rates. Once learned, it will be a tool you can utilize for the rest of your life.

Building Trust and Rapport:

It has been said that people buy from people they know, like, and trust.  That is a universally true statement.  At the beginning of a sales presentation, it is important to create rapport with the prospective client if you want to break down any existing barriers and build that trust.

In this tip-rich course, Eric teaches you numerous ways to accelerate the building of rapport. And, once that rapport is built, you will know how to leverage it to create the critical element of trust. 

Building trust and rapport with your prospect early in your presentation will help facilitate an atmosphere where the prospect will be considerably more receptive to your offerings. You may even notice their body language relax!

Handling Objections:

Objection handling is a critical skill set to learn to help maximize your sales results and your closing ratio.  Eric Lofholm has been successfully handling objections to close sales for over 25 years.  In this course, Eric shares his best objection handling ideas and strategies. 

By watching this module you will learn specific ideas that you can immediately use in your very next sales presentation to effectively handle the common objections you get.  Eric covers how to techniques including specific scripts to use to address the common objections.  He also covers the mindset of an objection handing master.  After watching this course expect to make a lot more sales!

Setting Goals:

Goal setting is quite likely the most endorsed personal development strategy in the world.  Goal setting is a learned skill.  The more you work on your goal setting skills the better you get.  In this course, Eric Lofholm shares his best goal-setting ideas from his 20+ years of applying goal-setting to his life and teaching goal-setting to others. 

The ideas in this module are a combination of the best goal-setting ideas Eric has learned from studying what success and business legends, Tony Robbins, Brian Tracy, Zig Ziglar, Napoleon Hill, Les Brown, and others had to say about goal setting.  Combine this with Eric's life experiences and you have this course.  By watching this course, you will improve your goal-setting skills now and forever.

Mindset of a B2B Sales Champion:

You’re taking this impactful course because you want to excel at sales. Think about the fact that you are selling every day, whether it’s in business or in your personal life. Every time you ask your children to do anything or make a request of anyone, you are selling. 

To achieve excellence in selling, you need to develop the mindset of a champion. Eric teaches you to be your number one cheerleader and get out of that present “story” you may be living in and potentially holding you back from the success you dream of. 

When you acknowledge yourself, it builds your self-esteem and confidence! Your learnings here could make a significant, positive effect on your life and the lives of others.

Closing B2B Sales Business:

In this module, you will learn how to close the B2B sale.  Closing is a learned skill.  Prior to me learning how to close I was the bottom producer on the team at my first sales job.  Once I learned how to close I 5x my sales results in less than 3 months. 

I have gone on to do millions and millions of dollars in B2B sales since.  In this course, I share with you my best ideas!  Many of the techniques you will literally be able to use in your very next sales presentation.

Enroll in this B2B Sales Course now.

Course Author:

Mr. Joao Martins is seasoned manager and entrepreneur, with over 30 years’ experience in top management positions in the telecommunications and IT sectors. Starting in an academic environment, where he obtained his PhD in Engineering and an MBA at Universidade Nova de Lisboa, quickly evolved to C-suite positions in the corporate environment, both in large corporations and in start-ups.

He is currently a director and start-up shareholder in an IT integrator in Lisbon, focused on cybersecurity. With a passion for education, he also an invited Professor at Nova Information Management School, teaching Knowledge Management and Financial Analysis to graduate and undergraduate students.


Course focuses:

Financial Statement Analysis will help business owners and other interested people to analyze the data in financial statements to provide them with better information about such key factors for decision making and ultimate business survival.


Financial Statement Analysis is the collective name for the tools and techniques that are intended to provide relevant information to the decision makers. The purpose of the FSA is to assess the financial health and performance of the company.


FSA consist of the comparisons for the same company over the period of time and comparisons of different companies either in the same industry or in different industries.


WHY IS IT IMPORTANT:

Financial statement analysis involves analyzing the information provided in the financial statements to:


Provide information about the organization's:

  • Past performance

  • Present condition

  • Future performance


Assess the organization's:

  • Earnings in terms of power, persistence, quality and growth

  • Solvency


Plan of lessons:

1. Accounting methods

- Introduction

- What is an account.

- Debit and credit operations

- Double entry accounting


2. Accounting Standards

- End of Period operations

- Introducing the financial statements


3. Financial Statements

- Main financial statements

- Interpreting the statements


4. Financial Statements

- Financial ratios

- Interpreting the ratios


5. Valuation principles

- Cost, Market and DCF

- DCF methodology

- WACC


6. Valuation principles

- 6 steps of DCF

- Terminal values

- Enterprise and equity values


Financial analysis is the process of evaluating businesses, projects, budgets, and other finance-related entities to determine their performance and suitability. It involves using various tools and techniques to assess the financial health of an organization, forecast future trends, and support decision-making.  


Key aspects of financial analysis include:

Assessing profitability: Evaluating a company's ability to generate profits over time, considering revenues, costs, and expenses.

Analyzing liquidity: Determining an organization's capacity to meet its short-term financial obligations and maintain sufficient cash flow.

Examining solvency: Assessing a company's long-term financial stability and ability to repay its debts.

Evaluating efficiency: Measuring how effectively a company utilizes its resources to generate revenues and manage expenses.

Forecasting future performance: Projecting financial outcomes based on historical data, market trends, and other relevant factors.


Importance of financial analysis skills for your career:

Improved decision-making: Financial analysis skills enable you to make informed decisions based on solid financial data, rather than relying on intuition or guesswork. This is crucial for choosing investments, managing budgets, and identifying growth opportunities.

Enhanced problem-solving: By understanding financial statements and analyzing trends, you can pinpoint areas of weakness or inefficiency within an organization and develop strategies to address them.

Increased career opportunities: Financial analysis skills are in high demand across various industries, opening doors to roles such as financial analyst, investment banker, portfolio manager, or management consultant.

Competitive advantage: Possessing strong financial analysis skills can differentiate you from other candidates in the job market and increase your earning potential.


Importance of financial analysis skills for building your own business:

Effective financial management: Understanding your company's financial performance is essential for making strategic decisions about pricing, marketing, product development, and resource allocation.

Securing funding: Investors and lenders rely on financial analysis to assess the viability and potential return on investment of your business. A strong financial track record and well-prepared financial projections can significantly increase your chances of securing funding.

Sustainable growth: By monitoring key financial metrics and identifying potential risks, you can make proactive adjustments to ensure the long-term sustainability and growth of your business.

Improved profitability: Financial analysis can help you identify areas where you can cut costs, increase revenues, and optimize your pricing strategy, ultimately leading to improved profitability.


In conclusion, financial analysis is a critical skill set that can significantly impact your career trajectory and your ability to build a successful business. Whether you're working for a large corporation or starting your own venture, honing your financial analysis skills can empower you to make informed decisions, solve complex problems, and achieve your financial goals.
targetAudiences: No special requirements. Course for any who want to build a career at business or improve their knowledge.

MTF is the global educational and research institute with HQ at Lisbon, Portugal, focused on business & professional hybrid (on-campus and online) education at areas: Business & Administration, Science & Technology, Banking & Finance.

MTF is the official partner of: IBM, Intel, Microsoft, member of the Portuguese Chamber of Commerce and Industry.

MTF is present in 210 countries and has been chosen by more than 485 000 students.


Course Author:

Lúcia de Fátima Silva Piedade has a Post-Doctorate in Aerospace Sciences, a PhD in Communication Sciences (organizational and crisis communication), a Master's Degree in Aeronautical Management and is an Architect. She has worked in aviation for 36 years, the last 20 as Operations Supervisor at Lisbon Airport. She is currently a lecturer at Universidade Lusófona and Universidade Atlântica.

Researcher at the Center for Research in Applied Communication, Culture and New Technologies (CICANT) and CEGIST-Center for Management Studies at Instituto Superior Técnico.


  • Postdoctorate in Aerospace Sciences

  • PhD in Communication Sciences (Organizational and Crisis Communication)

  • Master in Aeronautical Management

  • MBA in Air Transport Management /Civil Aviation

  • Architect

  • Operational Supervisor at Lisbon Airport

  • Assistant Professor at Universidade Lusófona de Humanidades e Tecnologias

  • CEGIST | Centre for Management Studies of Instituto Superior Técnico

  • CICANT | Centre for Research in Applied Communications, Culture and New Technologies

  • Global Goodwill Ambassadors Portugal - Board Director


The aviation, airline, air transportation, and airport industries form a complex and interconnected ecosystem that extends far beyond pilots, flight attendants, and air traffic controllers. A deep understanding of this ecosystem can open doors to a surprising array of career opportunities, both within and outside the industry itself.


Why Study Aviation, Airlines, Air Transportation, and Airports?

  • Understanding a Global Network: Aviation is a global industry that connects people, cultures, and economies. Learning about its operations provides insights into international business, logistics, supply chain management, and cross-cultural communication.

  • Technological Innovation: The aviation sector is at the forefront of technological advancements. Studying it exposes you to cutting-edge developments in aircraft design, navigation systems, artificial intelligence, data analytics, and sustainability initiatives.

  • Business and Management Skills: The industry offers diverse business models, from legacy airlines to low-cost carriers, airports, and maintenance providers. Studying these models enhances your understanding of strategic management, marketing, finance, and operations.

  • Regulatory and Policy Framework: Aviation is highly regulated for safety and security reasons. Understanding this framework is valuable for careers in law, policymaking, compliance, and risk management.

  • Sustainability and Environmental Impact: The industry is actively addressing its environmental footprint. Studying its sustainability efforts prepares you for careers in environmental consulting, renewable energy, and corporate social responsibility.


Who Benefits from Aviation Knowledge?

  • Engineers and Technicians: Design, maintain, and improve aircraft, airport infrastructure, and air traffic control systems.

  • Data Scientists and Analysts: Analyze passenger data, optimize flight schedules, and develop predictive models for maintenance and safety.

  • Marketing and Sales Professionals: Develop marketing campaigns, manage customer relationships, and promote aviation services.

  • Financial Analysts and Accountants: Manage budgets, analyze financial performance, and make investment decisions.

  • Legal and Compliance Professionals: Ensure regulatory compliance, draft contracts, and handle legal matters related to aviation.

  • Business Consultants: Advise airlines, airports, and other industry players on strategy, operations, and technology.


Linked Domains Where Aviation Knowledge is an Asset:

  • Tourism and Hospitality: Understand the needs of airline passengers, develop travel packages, and manage airport hotels and services.

  • Logistics and Supply Chain: Coordinate the movement of cargo, manage airport logistics, and ensure timely delivery of goods.

  • Manufacturing: Produce aircraft components, engines, and other aviation-related equipment.

  • Government and Regulatory Agencies: Develop aviation policies, enforce regulations, and promote safety and security.

  • Media and Journalism: Report on aviation news, analyze industry trends, and communicate complex information to the public.


Whether you aspire to a career directly within the aviation industry or in a related field, gaining a comprehensive understanding of aviation, airlines, air transportation, and airports is a strategic investment in your professional future. It equips you with a versatile skill set that is highly sought after in today's globalized and technology-driven economy.
targetAudiences: No special requirements. Course for any who want to build a career at Aviation, Airlines, Air Transportation and Airports or improve their knowledge.

courseDetails.title: Advanced Prompt Engineering Certification
courseDetails.shortDescription: From Prompt Crafter to Reasoning Architect: Mastering Cognitive Systems, Autonomous Agents, and Evolutionary Design.
courseDetails.longDescription:
This course contains the use of artificial intelligence!

Basic familiarity with LLMs (e.g., ChatGPT, Claude) is recommended.

Stop treating the AI like a chatbot and start treating it like a cognitive engine. This course will transform you from a Prompt Writer into a Systems Architect.

About this course:

  • From Tactics to Strategy: Move beyond simple "tips and tricks" into the engineering disciplines required for production-grade AI.

  • Battle-tested Architectures: Learn the exact reasoning structures (ToT, GoT, AoT) used to solve complex, high-stakes problems.

  • Unconditional 30-day money-back guarantee: My personal promise that you will master the ability to build reliable, self-correcting AI systems.

  • A step-by-step guide for designing autonomous agents and evolutionary prompts.

  • Full, free lifetime access to all course materials.

The knowledge this Advanced Cognitive Architecture course provides is truly state-of-the-art:

  • The Engineering Mindset: Shift from "vibe checking" to rigorous Accountability Protocols and the Traffic Light Framework for safety and liability1.


  • Context Architecture: Overcome the $O(N^2)$ complexity limit and "Context Rot" by designing rigorous Information Ecosystems using The Constitution and The Brief.


  • Psychological Signal Engineering: Use the Influence Layer and "Strategic Politeness" to statistically force the model into its high-effort, expert distribution.


  • Advanced Reasoning Frameworks: Go beyond Chain-of-Thought. Master Tree of Thoughts (ToT) for complex search 4, Graph of Thoughts (GoT) for non-linear synthesis 5, and Algorithm of Thought (AoT) for efficiency6.


  • Consensus & Verification: Eliminate hallucinations using Universal Self-Consistency and Triangulation to create "virtual committees" that verify their own facts.


  • The Self-Healing Pipeline: Build autonomous agents that don't just fail—they detect errors using a Diagnostic Lexicon and route them to a Debugger Agent for correction.


  • Evolutionary Prompting: The final frontier—replace human tuning with PROMPTBREEDER algorithms that allow the AI to mutate, breed, and evolve its own superior architectures.


Each section is a rigorous engineering deep-dive that provides not just the "how," but the mathematical and structural "why." You will stop writing sentences and start designing Glassbox Systems—observable, reliable, and precise.

After completing your course you can get your Advanced Cognitive Architecture Certification by following the instructions here: https://support.udemy.com/hc/en-us/articles/229603868-Certificate-of-Completion.
targetAudiences: AI Engineers, Developers, and "Prompt Crafters" ready to transition into "Cognitive Architects" capable of building enterprise-grade, autonomous AI systems.

Global Wealth Management and Private Banking (GWMPB) are specialized financial services catering to high-net-worth individuals (HNWIs) and ultra-high-net-worth individuals (UHNWIs). These services extend beyond traditional banking and encompass a comprehensive suite of financial solutions tailored to the unique needs and objectives of affluent clients.

Global Wealth Management focuses on managing and growing the wealth of HNWIs through a diverse range of investment strategies, including portfolio management, asset allocation, risk management, and financial planning. This holistic approach aims to preserve and enhance clients' wealth over the long term while addressing their specific financial goals, such as retirement planning, estate planning, and tax optimization.

Private Banking offers personalized banking services to HNWIs and UHNWIs. These services include bespoke banking solutions, exclusive investment opportunities, concierge services, and access to a dedicated relationship manager who understands their unique financial circumstances and aspirations. Private banks often act as trusted advisors, guiding clients through complex financial matters and providing tailored solutions to meet their evolving needs.

Why This Course?

Most courses focus on just one editing tool. But in today’s fast-paced content world, knowing only one platform limits your creative potential.
This course is designed for modern creators who need the flexibility to edit anywhere, anytime, on any device.

You will master:

  • CapCut – The mobile-friendly, fast, and free editor perfect for social media content creation

  • Adobe Premiere Pro – The industry-standard editing powerhouse for professional-grade projects

  • Canva – The ultimate design and video tool for creating branded, beautiful, and quick edits

What You Will Learn

  • Edit short-form content like TikTok videos, Instagram Reels, and YouTube Shorts

  • Create long-form, cinematic videos for YouTube, courses, or presentations

  • Add transitions, effects, music, and captions to make your videos stand out

  • Design thumbnails, intros, and outros that attract clicks

  • Use Canva for quick edits, animations, and branded content

  • Apply color grading, audio editing, and export settings for any platform

  • Follow best practices for social media growth through video editing

Who This Course Is For

  • Anyone who wants to make professional, engaging videos without expensive equipment


By the end of this course, you will have the skills, confidence, and creative workflow to edit any kind of video—whether it is for fun, social media growth, or professional projects.
targetAudiences: Anyone who wants to turn their raw footage into a polished, professional video.
